title: Self-Directed Online Microlearning Course on Absolute Structure Determination and Pharmaceutical Chemistry

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic organic chemistry and stereochemical concepts
context.additional_context: Microlearning optimized for non-face-to-face environments due to COVID-19, emphasizing visual learning using 3D molecular models. Formative assessments monitor learning gaps in real-time, with flexible scheduling tailored to individual learning paces.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain the absolute structure of an active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) using a 3D molecular model.
Learners can analyze the relationship between the stereochemical properties of optically active substances and drug efficacy.
Using an online quiz system, learners can achieve at least 80% proficiency in solving absolute structure determination problems.

resources: YouTube video resources (3D molecular model animations)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
